text: Greenko easily is one of the largest innovative

and reliable energy company
in the country.

We are delivering renewable energy
through solar, wind, hydro,
and we are scaling them at a rapid pace.
We are trying to build 30 Terawatt hours

of energy storage in the country
using 10 large mega projects.

And for me to run 10 large mega projects,
each spewing terabytes of data
every day needs a cloud provider,

it is very, very clear to us
that we needed to partner

with a very competent technology partner
who can provide solutions, who understands

our pain, who's global....nobody
other than AWS fits that bill.

The immediate opportunity that presented,
seemed to be something that's of very big interest

to us given our pipelines and our
ability to make tactical shifts in the marketplace

was to see how best we could leverage
AWS's machine learning and AI platform.

And obviously, as you start offering machine
learning and digital twinning capabilities,
it can provide real, real differentiators here.

Power is no longer just a commodity within
the consumer business or the industry.

But also, mobility is moving
towards power.

When we build a dam, when we
build a large hyrdo power project,
it's got to be there for a century.

When we build our solar plants with a given
PV on the end they're there for 25, 30 years.

In the last 1.5 years, we have seen AWS
not only try and position,

they are experts across the energy
and utility sectors

within the business,
but they also actually smartly

develop some of their
in-country system integrators,

and they're actually working closely
with us to try and understand

and be our feet
on the ground to support us.
So this is something

that we have also been telling other
players within our field go to AWS.
For an enterprise to be that sure

about what it wants to take,
the cloud can take time,

and that's not a small and medium business
doing things

that's not an agile business
wanting to do something different.

So we said AWS seems to have that skills
and capability and we saw that hunger

with the teams that were meeting us
that they were quite eager,
to understand and learn our business.

AWS carries a bundle of experience
and knowledge and actually today

is in a position to understand
very sector-specific solutions.

All the solutions that we are
trying to build for tomorrow

and that we are
building today for tomorrow
require us to have a very stable partner.
We are trying to solve the energy storage issues in the country,
which actually when we solve, we are solving a puzzle for the world.

So these are very, very tectonic shifts
that we are doing in the industry

which actually will move the industry
upside down.
So solutions are meant for the future.
And the kind of solutions

that we are trying to put on the table
today are the first anywhere in the world.
